in disas I am being careful with risk I'm not overly allocated or utilized right now most of the cash I have is kind of being transferred over into more of a holding pattern for at least till it needs not to be I will maintain some exposure as per usual just because you never know when things are going to grab some lights and start moving but right now things are slowing down so what is the cause of this what happened well first I want to be very clear that people really like to oversimplify things in markets and we like to have these really neat tidy little descriptors of what happened right why did X happen and a bunch of things happen today now nobody ever fully knows why everything goes the way it goes in the market typically unless there's a massive Catalyst I just like to call that out because getting into the news cycle of listening to CNBC or these other news sources say oh the SP 500 is down because of this it's probably partially because of that but then you also notice that the next day it'll be up because of a similar things so you just have to be careful otherwise if you get into this habit of these really neat succinct explanations for everything you start to oversimplify it just as a heuristic and you miss a lot of details now if I were to pinpoint though the primary drivers

similar things so you just have to be careful otherwise if you get into this habit of these really neat succinct explanations for everything you start to oversimplify it just as a heuristic and you miss a lot of details now if I were to pinpoint though the primary drivers for the movement today it's this right here I think J jobless claims came in very hot and this is really important because it's seen as a form of broad stock market weakness and this is important because we've been in this really high inflation period for so long and we've been at a point now where rates have been held up for quite some time that puts a lot of pressure on small companies specifically small caps typically everybody but specifically small caps and as this continues you get to a point where you're wondering when things are going to break when can they no longer sustain viable operation when do they have to start laying people off in order for this to continue to be economically viable for them and this all feeds into the Fed rate decision because the FED in the previous meeting said that they're not cutting rates and for the last meeting and the market didn't care that's what we expected to see but if we take a look at what the Market's expectations are for September it is that a cut is coming so now the question becomes how big of a cut

not cutting rates and for the last meeting and the market didn't care that's what we expected to see but if we take a look at what the Market's expectations are for September it is that a cut is coming so now the question becomes how big of a cut and notice the change yesterday it was an 88 probability of a quarter point cut today after that came out that dropped literally 10 points and we now have a 22 probability of a 50 basis point cut why is that because the market is starting to see weakness and if this persists for too long it's important to remember that there's leads and lags to all of this so if this continues at this rate it puts the market in a compromised position moving forward so that's why in my opinion a primary driver of this was the unemployment metric coming out and being much higher than pretty much everybody expected it to be so this will likely be an important data point for Big Daddy j po and his decision on what he wants to do with rates all right so now let's talk about GameStop quickly and it's because this trend is assuming so again this is I talked about this yesterday this is not surprising to me I don't want it to do this but this is what it's doing regardless of what I want Shocker the market is not listening to my wishes it's unbelievable
